div.p: Elder brother of pianist Paula Szalit.

div.head: Career summary
div.p: Born in Drohobycz, near Lemberg, he is said to have taught his younger sister, Paula, the basics of piano playing, in addition to which she may have studied at the Lemberg Conservatory. He took his sister when she was eight years old to Vienna, where she studied first with Robert Fischof. In 1902–1904, he – presumably Paula, too – was living at Vienna IX, Porzellangasse 54, his profession stated in the street directory as “pianist.” However, he apparently suffered from bad eyesight and had to relinquish hopes of a performance career.

Where he was immediately after 1904 is unknown. Paula was appointed to the piano faculty of the Lemberg Conservatory as the head of the advanced piano class. All that is known of Heinrich thereafter is an entry in the Karlsbader Kurliste (Karlsbad [=Karlovy Vary, in Bohemia] Court List) for July 22, 1909: Name and status: Mr. Heinrich Szalit, piano teacher, with wife Adele and son Emil | Usual residence: Drohobycz | Residence here: Amor, Morgenzeile.

div.head: Heinrich Szalit and Schenker
div.p: In an early but undated calling card, Paula sent “best wishes from Heinrich,” which indicates that the two men were acquainted, perhaps from the time Paula studied with Schenker in 1896 and 1897. Schenker’s diary for April 11, 1915 records: Mr. Heinrich Schalit arrives at my place to inquire if I might perhaps have some access to Rothschild or Springer, or someone like that, who could come with money to the aid of his sister, who was tragically injured in an accident. He takes the opportunity to inform me that Mr. Kux, Mrs. Popper, and Mrs. Eissler together provide 110 Kronen per month.
No correspondence between the two men is known to survive.
